Solar radiation (see Ultraviolet radiation (wavelengths 100–400 nm, encompassing UVA, UVB, and UVC); Ultraviolet radiation from welding; and Ultraviolet-emitting tanning devices)

alpha-Chlorinated toluenes (benzal chloride, benzotrichloride, benzyl chloride) and benzoyl chloride (combined exposures)

Aviation gasoline (see also Automotive gasoline, and Gasoline engine exhaust)
Human papillomavirus (HPV) types 5 and 8 (in patients with epidermodysplasia verruciformis)

Metallic implants prepared as thin smooth films
Polychlorophenols and their sodium salts (mixed exposures) (see Pentachlorophenol; 2,4,6-Trichlorophenol)

Leather goods manufacture (see also Leather dust)
Orthopaedic implants of complex composition and cardiac pacemakers
Other cobalt(II) compounds (not including Soluble cobalt(II) salts, Cobalt(II) oxide, Cobalt(II,III) oxide, and Cobalt(II) sulfide)
